Uses of Interface
ray.rage.scene.Node

  • Packages that use Node 
    Package Description
    ray.rage.scene  
    ray.rage.scene.controllers  
    ray.rage.scene.generic  

    • Uses of Node in ray.rage.scene

      Subinterfaces of Node in ray.rage.scene 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  SceneNode
      A scene node is a node used as the basis for a tree-based scene graph data structure, allowing scene-objects to be attached to the scene nodes.
      Methods in ray.rage.scene that return Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node Node.createChildNode(java.lang.String childName)
      Creates a new node that is a direct descendant of this one.
      Node Node.getChild(int index)
      Gets a direct descendant of this node, based on the order in which they were attached.
      Node Node.getChild(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a direct descendant of this node.
      Node Node.getParent()
      Gets this node's parent node, if any.
      Node SceneObject.getParentNode()
      Gets the scene-node to which this scene-object is attached, if any, as a regular node.
      Methods in ray.rage.scene that return types with arguments of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Iterable<Node> Node.getChildNodes()
      Gets an Iterable to go over the direct descendants of this node.
      Methods in ray.rage.scene with parameters of type Node 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Node.Controller.addNode(Node node)
      Adds a Node for this controller to control.
      void Node.attachChild(Node child)
      Adds a node as a child of this node.
      void Node.detachChild(Node child)
      Detaches the specified node from this node.
      void Node.lookAt(Node target)
      Makes this node look at the specified node.
      void Node.lookAt(Node target, Vector3 up)
      Makes this node look at the specified node using the specified world "up" vector.
      void Node.notifyAttached(Node newParent)
      Tells this node that it has been attached to the specified parent.
      void Node.Listener.onNodeAttached(Node child, Node newParent)
      A Node has been attached to a new parent.
      void Node.Listener.onNodeDetached(Node orphan, Node oldParent)
      A Node has been detached from its parent.
      void Node.Listener.onNodeUpdated(Node n)
      A Node has had its derived transforms updated.
      void Node.Controller.removeNode(Node node)
      Removes the specified node from this controller's control.

      Constructors in ray.rage.scene.controllers with parameters of type Node 
      Constructor and Description
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed, float distanceFromTarget)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed, float distanceFromTarget, float verticalDistance)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed, float distanceFromTarget, float verticalDistance, boolean faceTarget)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances, with the option to always keep facing the target.
